resources.string: Historic Paranthe Wali Gali became a renowned gourmet location after its parantha shops opened up there in the 1870s.
When it comes to kulfi (ice cream), some of the best has been made by the Roshan family in Karol Bagh since the early 1900s
Haldiram is India one of the most popular brand for snacks and Sweets. They offer a wide range of Sweets, Namkeens,gourmet food, Wraps and many more.
Looking for Amritsari food in Delhi? Kulcha King is the place for it.
Bishan Swaroop can be challenging to find but chat is worth it. Its hidden away in one of Chandni Chowks unruly side streets.
Rent a pocket WIFI to have internet access everywhere. It is very convenient when travelling since most of the hotels have limited internet access. It works even in the subway!

Did you forget your toothbrush? Are you jet-lagged and need a coffee fix at 4am? 

You need a Shopping store 24X7, a convenience store that is open 24/7. Here you will find from food and drinks, to first necessity articles. 

Some known 24X7 chains are in : 
- Kirti Nagar 
- Rajouri Garden 
- Terminal 1D 
- Cannaught Place

The Delhi Metro card is a prepaid smart card that allows you to use most public transport (metro train) in Delhi. The card is debited for every trip or purchase you make when you touch the card to the reader.
This huge shopping market in Delhi has been deliberately made to feel like a traditional weekly village market, called a haat.
Opposite INA Market, south Delhi. Pitampura
Khan Market is a small, U-shaped, well established shopping market in Delhi that’s one of Delhi’s classiest. Bargain hunters are likely to be disappointed at this market.
South New Delhi, not far from India Gate
This very popular and lively shopping market in Delhi, which was recently given a makeover, has something for everyone.You’ll find goods from everywhere in India and Tibet
Janpath, just off Connaught Place, in central New Delhi.
The shopping district of Chandni Chowk has been in existence for hundreds of years and an exploration of its winding, narrow alleyways is certainly an adventure.
Sarojini Nagar is most famous for its really cheap designer clothes and reputable brands that have been rejected from export, either because of surplus quantity or small manufacturing defects.
South West Delhi, near Safdarjung Airport.
The Red sandstone walls of the massive Red Fort (Lal Qila) rise 33-m above the clamour of Old Delhi as a reminder of the magnificent power and pomp of the Mughal emperors.
Netaji Subhash Marg, Red Fort Delhi
India Gate is a memorial to 82,000 soldiers of the Indian Army who died in the period 1914–21 in the First World War.
The Lotus Temple, located in Delhi, India, is a Bahai House of Worship that was dedicated in December 1986, having been completed for a total cost $10 million.
Near Kalkaji Temple, East of Nehru Place

Jantar Mantar (Yantra - instruments, mantra - formulae) was constrcted in 1724. Maharaja Jai Singh of Jaipur who built this observatory went on to build other observatories in Ujjain , Varanasi and Mathura.

Qutub Minar is a minaret that forms part of the Qutub complex, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, made of red sandstone and marble, Qutub Minar is a 73-metre (240 feet) tall tapering tower of five storeys.
The Rashtrapati Bhavan or Presidential Residence is the official home of the president located at the Western end of Rajpath in New Delhi, India.
Gurudwara Bangla Sahib is one of the most prominent Sikh gurdwara, or Sikh house of worship, in Delhi, India and known for its association with the eighth Sikh Guru, Guru Har Krishan.
